p:
Multiple viral infections are frequent in hospitalized children with respiratory tract disease, and may be linked to greater severity in symptoms and longer lengths of hospital stays.
29, 30 In contrast, although respiratory tract infections are commonly diagnosed and treated in the community, few studies report on the frequency of coinfection in this setting. A quarter of the ITTi population had a coinfection with another respiratory viral pathogen at baseline. Given that no data are available after baseline, there is a possibility that both baseline coinfections and later-onset coinfections contributed to a longer TTASS than may have been observed in the absence of coinfections.
